thread.title: Home Surveillance System Catches Burglary Suspects On Camera
thread.title_full: Home Surveillance System Catches Burglary Suspects On Camera

title: Home Surveillance System Catches Burglary Suspects On Camera
text:
Home Surveillance System Catches Burglary Suspects On Camera October 21, 2015, 11:30 AM SIOUX FALLS, SD - 
Sioux Falls Police hope someone recognizes burglary suspects caught on video from a home surveillance system. 
The video comes from a home in the southwest part of the city that's been hit by thieves in recent days. The video was shot on Saturday, October 17 around 4 a.m. 
Sunday evening, police responded to two burglary reports near 41st Street and Sertoma Avenue. In one case, a suspect entered an unlocked home on South Morrow Drive and left with cash. 
A second report came from West Oriole Circle. A suspect entered a garage, then moved to vehicles parked nearby but police didn't find evidence that anything was stolen from that home. 
Police think the same suspect is involved in both burglary reports. He was described by a witness as a tall, skinny man wearing a black-hooded sweatshirt. 
If you have information on the crimes, you are asked to call Crime Stoppers at 605-367-7007. Â© 2015 KELOLAND TV. All Rights Reserved.
